intro: Parnassia simaoensis, commonly known as the Simao buttercup, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white petals and yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, greenish-yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
